snippet: Conflicting accounts emerged on the death toll from a car bomb near the central city of Hama, with rebels reporting dozens of soldiers dead and the government saying just two civilians were killed.
abstract: Residents of Damascus say city is experiencing some of the worst violence they can remember since July, with thousands of people fleeing heavy shelling, air attacks and bombings; Palestinian faction that supports Assad government skirmishes with rebels in three southern neighborhoods.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut; Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Conflicting accounts emerged on the death toll from a car bomb near the central city of Hama, with rebels reporting dozens of soldiers dead and the government saying just two civilians were killed.

headline.seo: Syrian Rebels Claim to Kill Dozens of Soldiers
headline.main: Dozens Are Killed in a Fierce Outburst of Syrian Violence
headline.print_headline: Dozens Are Killed in a Fierce Outburst of Syrian Violence
